streetNr.description: Number identifying a specific property on a public street. It may be combined with streetNrLast for ranged addresses

streetNrLast.description: Last number in a range of street numbers allocated to a property

streetNrLastSuffix.description: Last street number suffix for a ranged address

streetName.description: Name of the street or other street type

streetType.description: Alley, avenue, boulevard, brae, crescent, drive, highway, lane, terrace, parade, place, tarn, way, wharf

streetSuffix.description: A modifier denoting a relative direction

locality.description: The locality that the address is in

city.description: The city that the address is in

stateOrProvince.description: The State or Province that the address is in

postcode.description: Descriptor for a postal delivery area, used to speed and simplify the delivery of mail (also known as zipcode)

postcodeExtension.description: An extension of a postalcode. E.g. the part following the dash in an american urban property address.

country.description: Country that the address is in

siteName.description: A name by which the site is known

siteCompanyName.description: The name of the company located at the service site

endCustomerName.description: The name of the end (retail) customer.

additionalSiteInformation.description: Additional information about the Site or special delivery information

siteDescription.description: A description for the service site

SubAddress.description: It is used for addressing within a property in an urban area (country properties are often defined differently). It may refer to a building, a building cluster, or a floor of a multistory building.

subUnitType.description:
The type of subunit
e.g.BERTH, FLAT, PIER, SUITE, SHOP, TOWER, UNIT, WHARF.

subUnitNumber.description:
The discriminator used for the subunit
often just a simple number e.g. FLAT 5, may also be a range

levelType.description: Describes level types within a building

levelNumber.description: Used where a level type may be repeated e.g. BASEMENT 1, BASEMENT 2

buildingName.description: Allows for buildings that have well-known names

privateStreetNumber.description: Private streets numbers internal to a private street

privateStreetName.description: Private streets internal to a property (e.g. a university) may have internal names that are not recorded by the land title office
